verses.kjv: For Zion’s sake will I not hold my peace, and for Jerusalem’s sake I will not rest, until the righteousness thereof go forth as brightness, and the salvation thereof as a lamp that burneth.
verses.ct: For the sake of Zion I will not stay silent, and for the sake of Jerusalem I will not stop speaking, until her righteousness shines out like the dawn, and her salvation blazes like a burning torch.

verses.kjv: And the Gentiles shall see thy righteousness, and all kings thy glory: and thou shalt be called by a new name, which the mouth of the LORD shall name.
verses.ct: The nations will witness your righteousness, and every king will see your glory. You will be given a new name — one that the LORD himself will choose for you.

verses.kjv: Thou shalt also be a crown of glory in the hand of the LORD, and a royal diadem in the hand of thy God.
verses.ct: You will be a beautiful crown held in the LORD's hand, a royal headpiece in the grip of your God.

verses.kjv: Thou shalt no more be termed Forsaken; neither shall thy land any more be termed Desolate: but thou shalt be called Hephzibah, and thy land Beulah: for the LORD delighteth in thee, and thy land shall be married.
verses.ct: No one will call you 'Abandoned' anymore, and your land will no longer be called 'Desolate.' Instead, you will be named Hephzibah, and your land will be called Beulah, because the LORD takes delight in you, and your land will be joined to him like a bride.

verses.kjv: For as a young man marrieth a virgin, so shall thy sons marry thee: and as the bridegroom rejoiceth over the bride, so shall thy God rejoice over thee.
verses.ct: Just as a young man marries a young woman, your people will be united with you. And just as a groom celebrates over his bride, your God will celebrate over you.

verses.kjv: I have set watchmen upon thy walls, O Jerusalem, which shall never hold their peace day nor night: ye that make mention of the LORD, keep not silence,
verses.ct: Jerusalem, I have stationed guards on your walls who will never be silent, day or night. You who call on the LORD, do not stop speaking —

verses.kjv: And give him no rest, till he establish, and till he make Jerusalem a praise in the earth.
verses.ct: and give him no rest until he establishes Jerusalem and makes it a source of praise throughout the earth.

verses.kjv: The LORD hath sworn by his right hand, and by the arm of his strength, Surely I will no more give thy corn to be meat for thine enemies; and the sons of the stranger shall not drink thy wine, for the which thou hast laboured:
verses.ct: The LORD has made a solemn oath by his powerful right hand and his mighty arm: 'I will never again let your grain be taken as food for your enemies, and foreigners will never again drink the wine that you worked so hard to produce.

verses.kjv: But they that have gathered it shall eat it, and praise the LORD; and they that have brought it together shall drink it in the courts of my holiness.
verses.ct: Instead, those who harvest the grain will eat it and give thanks to the LORD, and those who gather the grapes will drink the wine in the courtyards of my holy place.'

verses.kjv: Go through, go through the gates; prepare ye the way of the people; cast up, cast up the highway; gather out the stones; lift up a standard for the people.
verses.ct: Pass through, pass through the gates! Clear a path for the people! Build up, build up the highway! Remove every stone from the road! Raise a banner high for the nations to see!

verses.kjv: Behold, the LORD hath proclaimed unto the end of the world, Say ye to the daughter of Zion, Behold, thy salvation cometh; behold, his reward is with him, and his work before him.
verses.ct: Look — the LORD has sent this announcement to the ends of the earth: 'Tell the people of Zion: Look, your salvation is on its way! See, he brings his reward with him, and the result of his work goes ahead of him.'

verses.kjv: And they shall call them, The holy people, The redeemed of the LORD: and thou shalt be called, Sought out, A city not forsaken.
verses.ct: They will be called 'The Holy People,' 'The Redeemed of the LORD.' And you will be known as 'Sought After,' 'A City No Longer Abandoned.'
